advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic light—it’s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstar’s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

editorialNotes.standard: The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but there’s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

editorialNotes.tagline: Ollie and flip for high scores
editorialNotes.standard: Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axis’ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind, and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps, and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: While Hitman GO carved out a bold new direction for Agent 47, his next iOS mission expertly captures the riveting gameplay of the venerable console series. You won’t be donning disguises to sneak into enemy compounds (the game’s all about sniping), but you still carefully scout each location, unravel the intricately woven level design, and then strike with impeccable timing—or die and try again. Hitman: Sniper does its legacy proud with 150 missions full of engrossing action and the series’ quirky sense of humor.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Prove your penitence by parrying snakes with oversize fangs in this bleak but beautiful platformer.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Dead Cells is a celebration of perseverence: In this game, death is never final, but an essential learning tool. With every new run through ever-changing, enemy-infested levels, you get a little stronger and a little more skilled at overcoming relentless adversaries—and gradually overcome obstacles that once felt insurmountable. The acclaimed roguelike platformer makes all rewards feel earned; you'll be motivated to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.
Follow the story of the acclaimed anime—or hop straight into battle as your favorite heroes—in the action-packed mobile version of the 2008 fighting game.

The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: In this gorgeous twist on the infinite runner, you guide an agile snowboarder down a never-ending mountain, pulling off backflips over icy chasms and grinding along rooftops in sleepy villages. Simple one-finger controls make it instantly accessible, but tackling each level’s trio of challenges requires deft reflexes. With its exquisitely rendered visuals, soothing music, and finely tuned gameplay, Alto’s Adventure is simultaneously serene and exciting.
editorialNotes.short: We're obsessed with nailing the perfect run while admiring the gorgeous scenery.

editorialNotes.tagline: A classic that never gets old

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.
editorialNotes.standard:
One of the App Store’s early sensations, Doodle Jump has only improved with age. 

The superbly simple gameplay remains: tilt your device to hop up an endless series of platforms, blasting bad guys, grabbing power-ups, and making your mark on a global leaderboard. Hand-drawn visuals add quirky appeal, while an evolving mix of doodled worlds, special items, and whimsical characters keep this indie classic fresh.

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror
Clean up Gotham one brick at a time
editorialNotes.standard: Warner Bros. continues its tradition of App Store excellence with this clever bite-sized brawler, which mashes up the family-friendly LEGO brand with a classic comic-style good vs. evil story. Whether you take up Batman's cape and cowl or step into the shoes of a number of other Justice League heroes, saving Gotham City is a charming adventure for gamers of all ages.

editorialNotes.tagline: Can you become king of the hill?

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Pixel-perfect art brings a lost world to life in the gorgeous Hyper Light Drifter. Explore vivid forests, bright landscapes, and the shell of a high-tech society overgrown by nature as you seek to cure a fatal illness. Packing silky smooth, lightning-fast combat, Hyper Light Drifter is a blast—even when you’re just admiring the scenery.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters, and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative, and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

Set in a snowy Nordic fantasy world, Bad North is about doing the best you can with what you’ve got. Command troops of archers, swordsmen, and more as you protect a chain of islands from marauders, but one wrong move can prove costly. Tense, slick, and stylish, Bad North is a heady blend of tactical combat, strategic planning, and intuitive controls.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, it’s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

ios.subtitle: It’s not a bug, it’s a feature
enjoy your Game on your Watch

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Building upon 2K’s tactical masterpiece XCOM: Enemy Unknown, Enemy Within adds a bevy of new features that fundamentally alter and improve the experience. With new abilities and mission parameters unlocked from the very first mission, Enemy Within injects tension and surprise into every corner. Fans of Enemy Unknown will find a wealth of new weapons, enemies, and maps that change the game’s flow, while new players will be enthralled as they fend off an alien invasion in intense, turn-based battles.

Frogmind’s follow-up to our 2013 iPad Game of the Year has our minds in apocalyptic overdrive. We can’t stop thinking about all the whirring blades, crushing boulders, and other deathtraps you have to fly, fall, and roll through. The physics-based puzzles are even more clever this time around, flowing from one to the next in sprawling, eerily beautiful levels laced with dread. Badland 2’s elegant controls and frequent checkpoints make it easy to pick up and love, but its wealth of missions and online challenges will wow even the most hardcore players.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Terry Cavanagh’s Super Hexagon is quite simply one of the most challenging games we’ve ever played. A pulsating chiptunes soundtrack underscores the danger as swirling walls close in around you and you race to escape the contracting maze. With the geometric action heaping on the punishment (the easiest difficulty is appropriately labeled “Hard”), every small achievement feels like a massive victory, whether you’re topping your high score or overcoming a singularly tricky section.
editorialNotes.short: This is still one of our favorites. Few games are this satisfying to master.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A well is usually one of the last things we’d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. It’s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means you’re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone, and laser sights) give you all the help you’ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.

ios.subtitle: Feed Hungry Fish And Grow Big
